file_content.text: Speak to another. You have no business here.
The Rattataki must remain outside. The master has not requested her presence.
Looks like I'll have to miss this one, then. Real shame.
You don't have to go, Kaliyo. Listen--
That's not necessary.
Ah, don't worry about it. Now that I'm a loyal Imperial agent, who am I to defy the Dark Council's wishes?
I'll meet you when we're done in here.
See you later.
Sure thing, agent.
Try not to cause too much trouble while I'm gone, all right?
Behave yourself.
We're in the capital. How much trouble do you expect me to cause?
Come. Stand before me, and revel in the power of the Dark Council.
Allow your body to betray you. Allow your blood to boil and your heart to slow. Everything that is not of the dark side will be purged--or it will be tainted.
This is inoculation, agent. This is a sacred rite. You are privileged.
It is an honor, my lord.
Thank you.
It has been earned.
The religion of the Sith is not my religion.
According to your beliefs.
The ways of the Sith are the ways of the Empire--so it shall always be. But that is not why I summoned you.
Your parlor tricks don't frighten me, Lord Jadus.
I'm not impressed.
Adolescent defiance will not serve you here; when the time comes, you will beg to feel my power again. But that is not why I summoned you.
This is your due reward. You proved yourself by outmaneuvering the Hutts. Now I choose you to exterminate the dissidents who would destroy our way of life.
I sense your uncertainty--you wonder why I involve myself in this affair, why I take an interest in you and Imperial Intelligence.
I wouldn't presume to wonder. It's not my place to question you.
Your decisions are beyond me.
As you say.
Yes, my lord.
I have to admit--the question crossed my mind.
You sense correctly.
Many in the Dark Council hold themselves above the mundane business of the Empire. I believe this is a mistake.
I believe we must spread the ways of the Sith to the Empire entire--plant terror and hatred in every heart. I believe in the democratization of fear.
But these dissidents threaten all progress. Left unchecked, they would reduce our world to ash and raise nothing in its place.
The dissidents will be stopped. Imperial Intelligence is already uncovering their plan.
We'll defeat them.
What do they want, aside from the destruction of the Empire?
But why?
They want what children want--unlimited freedom without responsibility. This makes them no less dangerous.
The Empire has overcome worse foes than these malcontents.
They're insignificant.
Do not underestimate our enemies. They are powerful--and there are those who sympathize with them. People at the highest levels of government.
I chose you for this assignment not only because of your successes, but because you are an outsider--an alien whom your superiors disdain and overlook. Your loyalty is uncompromised.
I don't know what you're talking about. My species has never been an issue.
Intelligence isn't anti-alien.
Are you implying there's a conspiracy in Imperial Intelligence?
You don't trust my superiors.
I believe I understand, my lord.
I see.
I chose you for this assignment not only because of your past successes, but because you are new to your organization. Your loyalty is uncompromised. Do you understand?
I believe so, my lord.
Indeed.
Good. Watch those around you, and trust no one.
Do you think there are traitors among us?
You don't trust Intelligence.
Watch those around you, and trust no one. You will see the truth for yourself.
Am I supposed to serve you instead of Keeper?
What are you suggesting?
Serve your Empire. Watch those around you and trust no one.
I will leave Dromund Kaas soon aboard the starship Dominator. I will travel with a thousand dignitaries, diplomats and slaves, and show them the galaxy as I envision it.
When I return, I expect the dissidents to have been purged. Kneel before me now, and I will ensure that you have the means to succeed.
I kneel before you, my lord.
As you wish.
It's not as if I have much choice. I'll kneel.
If I must.
With respect, Lord Jadus--I will not bow to you.
I won't.
You do not wish to refuse me, agent. Consider your defiance in the face of the Dark Council.
I... acknowledge your position. I kneel and obey.
Very well.
I apologize, my lord. You're right, of course--I kneel and obey.
Forgive me for my foolishness.
You choose your alliances well. Accept my gift--the weapon of my personal guard.
I have remade the pitiful creatures around you into my image. So shall I remake you into the vessel for my power.
Now go from here, and return to your duties.
Yes, Lord Jadus.
Of course.
I've learned a great deal. Thank you for this audience.
It's been enlightening.
Remember what I have said. Remember that you walk the path to power--and remember that I am eternal.
We'll meet again--sooner or later.
This isn't over.
Remember, agent--defy me, and you can be made a hollow shell. My power over you is complete.
Now go. I leave Dromund Kaas presently, and you must return to your duties.
I won't be your puppet. Do what you will.
Absolutely not.
Then consider this a small example of my power. When you awaken, remember it as the price of arrogance.
The master has not requested your presence. You are not permitted here.
